channel.title: Max FPS
channel.description:
Got a new graphics card today, and just wanted to see what my FPS were. Turns out it's a damn good upgrade.
[IMG]http://i1115.photobucket.com/albums/k557/Lord_Zymus/2011-08-20_215442.png[/img]
Options: Graphics: Fast Smooth Lighting: Off Render Distance: Normal Performance: Balanced Advanced OpenGL: On

item.title: Max FPS
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

Damn everyday I play Minecraft I regret buying the light weight portable lap top.

Read full topic

item.title: Max FPS
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

[quote=“hat trix, post:9, topic:411325”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=512590.msg3723688#msg3723688 date=1314128661]

[quote author=whattehp406 link=topic=512590.msg3723680#msg3723680 date=1314128066]

I dunno why but I always get exactly 60fps when using OSX. I don’t get any performance issues and it doesn’t matter if my render is tiny or far, it just seems to be capped at 60. Anyone know the reason?
[/quote]check your minecraft settings, you can cap your fps with them.
[/quote]The performance thingy is on Max FPS, this means it’s not capped right?

I just logged in and now it’s fluctuating between 50-60, and is always equal to the number of chunk updates. Is it normal to average 60 chunk updates even when standing still?

try downloading a mod like optifine or even optifog. there are texture packs that can help as well. i was hitting 100 fps before using the mods and now im hitting around 150-200.[/quote]

optifine is optifog and optimine together you know that right?

Read full topic

item.title: Max FPS
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

I’m hitting 15fps, good isn’t it? I used to be getting 25 but now I’m just not.

Read full topic

item.title: Max FPS
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:7, topic:411325”][quote author=whattehp406 link=topic=512590.msg3723680#msg3723680 date=1314128066]

[quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=512590.msg3722691#msg3722691 date=1314052625]
I dunno why but I always get exactly 60fps when using OSX. I don’t get any performance issues and it doesn’t matter if my render is tiny or far, it just seems to be capped at 60. Anyone know the reason?
[/quote]check your minecraft settings, you can cap your fps with them.
[/quote]The performance thingy is on Max FPS, this means it’s not capped right?

I just logged in and now it’s fluctuating between 50-60, and is always equal to the number of chunk updates. Is it normal to average 60 chunk updates even when standing still?[/quote]

try downloading a mod like optifine or even optifog. there are texture packs that can help as well. i was hitting 100 fps before using the mods and now im hitting around 150-200.

Read full topic

[/quote]check your minecraft settings, you can cap your fps with them.
[/quote]The performance thingy is on Max FPS, this means it’s not capped right?

I just logged in and now it’s fluctuating between 50-60, and is always equal to the number of chunk updates. Is it normal to average 60 chunk updates even when standing still?[/quote]

if you stand completely still(not even moving your camera) it will drop to 0 after like 10 - 20 secs

item.title: Max FPS
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

Yea what mitb, anything above 80fps you wont tell a bit of difference, that is with a 60hz monitor, id love to have a 120hz monitor or a plasma monitor, so smooooooth

I average 350 - 480 with 0 chunk updates with those same settings, 150 - 250 with normal chunk updates

Read full topic

item.title: Max FPS
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:2, topic:411325”]Sorry to burst your bubble, but your post got me curious and I get the same framerate (varies between 360-460fps normally) with my quite old video card (Nvidia 8800GTS), and the same settings as you. That’s just how minecraft works I guess. Also, anything over the refresh rate of your monitor (probably 60hz, or 60fps) you don’t see anyhow.

Out of curiosity though, what kind of card did you get?

edit: Offtopic, love the signature, I bet fewer people know where that came from than know where mopar came from. :D[/quote]

Aw My old graphics card (Radeon HD 4890) was only giving me ~200; and it’s only 2 years old!

I got a new Nvidia GeForce GTX 460.

And thanks out of all the episodes, that one meant the most to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Max FPS
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Sorry to burst your bubble, but your post got me curious and I get the same framerate (varies between 360-460fps normally) with my quite old video card (Nvidia 8800GTS), and the same settings as you. That’s just how minecraft works I guess. Also, anything over the refresh rate of your monitor (probably 60hz, or 60fps) you don’t see anyhow.

Out of curiosity though, what kind of card did you get?

edit: Offtopic, love the signature, I bet fewer people know where that came from than know where mopar came from.

Read full topic
